docs.snippet: Obama outperforming Kerry among white men so far....
docs.lead_paragraph: The augury of exit polls: Philip Klein of The American Spectator tries to divine the future from the first wave of exit polls and is discouraged about the way things seem to be going for John McCain on Election Day.
docs.abstract: Obama outperforming Kerry among white men so far.

docs.snippet: Heavy voter turnout may not necessarily hurt Republican state senators, like Frank Padavan, who are fighting to hold onto their seats....
docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats in the State Senate are hoping that a surge of young voters and black voters arriving at the polls today to vote for Barack Obama will help their candidates down the ballot, particularly in those districts that are represented by Republicans but have a large number of black voters.
docs.abstract: Heavy voter turnout may not necessarily hurt Republican state senators, like Frank Padavan, who are fighting to hold onto their seats.

headline.main: High Turnout Might Not Hurt Padavan

docs.snippet: For Republicans, some good news in a hypothetical Democratic blowout?...
docs.lead_paragraph: If Barack Obama triumphs over John McCain in an electoral landslide, some conservatives might take some solace from the overwhelming nature of the defeat.
docs.abstract: For Republicans, some good news in a hypothetical Democratic blowout?

docs.snippet: Brian Stelter of TV Decoder blogs about the media on election night....
docs.lead_paragraph: The TV Decoder blogger Brian Stelter and a team of media reporters watched the coverage of Election Night (and beyond) and reported from networks, newsrooms and parties on both coasts. Add comments below or send feedback via Twitter.

docs.snippet: This is a victory not for one man or one party, but for opportunity itself. Right now I'm trying to get my 11-year-old daughter to bed, but she is celebrating and insists that she wants to wait up half the night. Several times this fall she and a ...
docs.lead_paragraph: This is a victory not for one man or one party, but for opportunity itself. Right now I'm trying to get my 11-year-old daughter to bed, but she is celebrating and insists that she wants to wait up half the night. Several times this fall she and a friend spent their afternoons and weekends selling lemonade and cookies to raise money for Obama, and she's just thrilled at what appears to be the outcome. It's clear that she'll be telling her grandchildren about this night.
docs.abstract: This is a victory not for one man or one party, but for opportunity itself. Right now I'm trying to get my 11-year-old daughter to bed, but she is celebrating and insists that she wants to wait up half the night. docs.snippet: Shays of Connecticut is another Republican loss....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the Obama victory the big news and the Senate scramble the undercard, the House has been relegated to bit player in tonight's drama. However, there was a watershed development in the peoples' branch: Chris Shays of the Connecticut, the last Republican in the Northeast, has been defeated. And while Democrats may be pleased, not all conservatives are crying in their beer, including W.C. Varones at Polipundit:
docs.abstract: Shays of Connecticut is another Republican loss.

docs.snippet: Before Senator Barack Obama of Illinois, there was Gov. Tim Pettigrew of New York, the first black presidential nominee for the Democratic Party....
docs.lead_paragraph: Before Senator Barack Obama of Illinois, there was Gov. Tim Pettigrew of New York, the first black presidential nominee for the Democratic Party. But that happened in 1976, and in the pages of "Treasure Chest," a comic book distributed to Catholic school students around the country.
docs.abstract: Before Senator Barack Obama of Illinois, there was Gov. Tim Pettigrew of New York, the first black presidential nominee for the Democratic Party.
